title: A person bought 76 cows and sold 20 cows at 15% profit, 40 cows at 19% profit and remaining 16 cows at 25% and got a profit of Rs.7300 as a whole. Find the cost price of each cow? - Quora

response.answer_text: Assume cost of each cow = x Profit per cow at 15% profit = 0.15x Profit for 20 cows at 25% profit = 0.15x * 20 = 3x Similarly, Profit for 40 cows at 19% profit = 0.19x*40 = 7.6x Profit for 16 cows at 25% profit = 0.25x*16 = 4x Total profit = 3x + 7.6x + 4x 7300 = 14.6x x = 500 Ans : Cost of each cow is Rs 500 only…
